results.definition: in baseball; a batter's attempt to hit a pitched ball
a style of jazz played by big bands popular in the 1930s; flowing rhythms but less complex than later styles of jazz
make a big sweeping gesture or movement
a jaunty rhythm in music
move or walk in a swinging or swaying manner
be a social swinger; socialize a lot
the act of swinging a golf club at a golf ball and (usually) hitting it
hang freely
changing location by moving back and forth
influence decisively
alternate dramatically between high and low values
examples: the market is swinging up and down

results.definition: a square dance figure; a pair of dancers join hands and dance around a point between them
a state of steady vigorous action that is characteristic of an activity
examples: the party went with a swing
it took time to get into the swing of things

results.definition: a sweeping blow or stroke
examples: he took a wild swing at my head

results.definition: change direction with a swinging motion; turn
engage freely in promiscuous sex, often with the husband or wife of one's friends
examples: There were many swinging couples in the 1960's

results.definition: have a certain musical rhythm
hit or aim at with a sweeping arm movement
examples: The soccer player began to swing at the referee

results.definition: live in a lively, modern, and relaxed style
examples: The Woodstock generation attempted to swing freely

results.definition: mechanical device used as a plaything to support someone swinging back and forth
move in a curve or arc, usually with the intent of hitting
play with a subtle and intuitively felt sense of rhythm
